node.title: George, Julia and Jonathan, too. Star power supercharges small-town Queensland's big-budget screen boom
node.alt: Australian Survivor host Jonathan LaPaglia stands with his arms crossed in the outback.
node.description: With Hollywood superstars, a reality TV hit, hundreds of jobs and many millions of dollars, locations like Charters Towers are not only surviving, they're thriving on a string of film and TV productions.
node.content:
["Regional Queensland is reaping the benefits of a coronavirus-driven screen boom, with major screen productions seeking safe harbour from the pandemic injecting millions of dollars into local economies.", "In the past year, 13 productions \u2013 including international feature films, documentaries and TV series \u2013 have been filmed in regional locations across the state.", "\"This is definitely the biggest boom we've seen in terms of dollar value and job creation in the regions,\" Screen Queensland chief executive Kylie Munnich said.", "\"We've had $478 million worth of production come into the state in the last financial year.", "", "
Julia Roberts and George Clooney are filming in the\u00a0Whitsundays.(AP)
", "Julia Roberts and George Clooney this week started filming Hollywood romantic comedy Ticket to Paradise in the Whitsundays and the cameras are rolling on new Netflix series Irreverent\u00a0at Mission Beach.", "Unable to travel overseas, one of Australia's biggest reality TV shows, Survivor, is shooting its second successive season in regional Queensland \u2013 this time at Charters Towers.", "
Reality\u00a0sets in for old mining town
", "About 350 production crew members have descended on the small town, about 130kms southwest\u00a0of Townsville.", "Survivor production executive Elliot Luxton said Charters Towers offered a \"unique solution for filming\" in the midst of COVID-19 chaos.", "\"The logistics involved in shooting Survivor are massive, so it's important for us to find a town that can facilitate that,\" Mr\u00a0Luxton said.", "", "
Locals say Charters Towers has been buzzing since the region was selected as the location for the next season of Survivor.\u00a0(ABC News: Lily Nothling)
", "The diverse, untamed North Queensland landscape is a far cry from the lush island destinations typically picked for the series.", "\"The crew and participants are used to a tropical beach location\u00a0whereas, in Australia, we brought it back to what people are expecting to see, which is the red dirt and the very harsh, arid climate,\" Mr Luxton said.", "", "
Elliot Luxton.(ABC News: Lily Nothling.)
", "Scouting for locations has taken months\u00a0and the show will film at about 20 different sites, thrusting the region into the national spotlight.", "Unable to house the influx of new arrivals, a temporary accommodation camp has been set up on the outskirts of town.", "Charters Towers Mayor Frank Beveridge said he was \"absolutely ecstatic\" to have secured the production.", "\"Obviously with COVID\u00a0it's meant the major capital cities have closed down and people have come to the regions, but this is really the icing on the cake,\" Cr Beveridge said.", "\"Just one of the hardware [stores] alone, they're selling enough equipment to build between four and five houses for this one production.\"", "", "
Charters Towers Mayor Frank Beveridge at Australian Survivor base camp.\u00a0(Supplied: Charters Towers Regional Council.)
", "Overall, the production is expected to inject $17 million into Queensland.", "
'Town's alive' and business is thriving
", "Brad Chilton's holiday park is fully booked with production crew, contractors and contestants.", "This is now his best year on record and Mr Chilton said he'd love to see the crew come back.", "\"It's great for the town \u2013 they're spending money, the town's alive,\" he said.", "\"You can't do much better than that.\"", "", "
Brad Chilton's holiday park has had its best year.\u00a0(ABC News: Lily Nothling.\u00a0)
", "Jane Jesberg, who owns The Rix pub, said the Survivor crew had become daily customers.", "\"A lot of them have come from Melbourne, just in the last couple of weeks, and hadn't eaten in a restaurant in 12 months,\" Ms Jesberg said.", "\"I think they genuinely were overwhelmed by the fact that they could be in this community without masks and that they could live so freely.\"", "The series will take eight weeks to film, but Cr Beveridge said he was optimistic the region would continue to reap the benefits after the cameras stopped rolling.", "\"When Charters Towers comes up on the credits, that will just boost significantly our international and local tourism for many years to come,\" he said.", "", "
Charters Towers publican Jane Jesberg says Survivor has \"breathed life\" into town.\u00a0(ABC News: Lily Nothling.)
", "Screen Queensland acknowledges the pandemic has played a big part in Queensland's recent screen success.", "But Ms Munnich said she was confident the production boom was sustainable, even after domestic and international travel resumed.", "\"We field inquiries daily and weekly for productions wanting to come into Queensland \u2013 they could be from interstate or they could be from overseas,\" she said.", "Last month, the Queensland Government announced the construction of a $6.8 million film and television studio in Cairns.", "\"It will hopefully be up and running by the middle of next year and be a real anchor point to attract productions to the far north and provide a dedicated production facility,\" Ms Munnich said.", "The state has also committed $4 million over four years to expand screen opportunities in North Queensland, encourage more regional production and upskill local workers.", "\"We're very focused on 2022 \u2026 and absolutely maintaining this momentum,\" Ms Munnich said."]
